document.ModsDocTitle: On the identity of the adventive species of Eufriesea Cockerell in the USA: systematics and potential distribution of the coerulescens species group (Hymenoptera, Apidae)
document.docAuthor: Gonzalez, Victor H., Griswold, Terry & Simoes, Marianna
document.masterDocTitle: On the identity of the adventive species of Eufriesea Cockerell in the USA: systematics and potential distribution of the coerulescens species group (Hymenoptera, Apidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the identity of the adventive species of Eufriesea Cockerell in the USA: systematics and potential distribution of the coerulescens species group (Hymenoptera, Apidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Eufriesea micheneri Ayala & Engel, 2008 Male, Figs 6, 18, 19, 20, 112-117, 118-123; Female, Figs 30, 32, 66, 124-127

Eufriesea micheneri
Ayala & Engel, 2008: 228 (Holotype: UNAM; ♂, Mexico: Jalisco, Mascota)

caption.paragraph: Figures 112-117. Male paratype of E. micheneri (Mexico: Jalisco, Mascota, KUNHM-ENT 1121713). 112 Facial view 113 Lateral habitus 114 Dorsal habitus; 115 Outer view of hind leg 116 Ventral view of metatrochanter with arrow pointing to distinct projection 117 Second metasomal tergum.

subSubSection.paragraph: ♂, As described for E. engeli except as follows: Head width 6.3 mm; body length 17.8 mm; forewing length 16.3 mm. Metabasitarsus with inner surface near base strongly protuberant in frontal view, posterodistal margin angled. Hidden sterna and genitalia as in Figs 118-123.

Mandible black with green, blue, and purple hues on basal third as on labrum; face green with golden and blue hues; vertex and gena blue with purple hues. Meso- and metasoma blue with green hues on anterior two-thirds of mesoscutum and disc of tegula, weak purple hues on remainder areas of mesosoma and marginal zones of terga and sterna.

Face with off-white setae, vertex and gena with gray to black setae. Mesosoma with gray to black setae except on outer surfaces of mesobasitarsi and distitarsi. Mesotibia with area between medial margin of posterior patch and anterior margin of tibia bare on distal half; posterior patch subapically about as broad as distance between its medial margin and anterior margin of tibia. Metasoma with gray setae on terga, white or off-white on S3-S5.
Disc of T2 with finer and sparser punctures than on E. barthelli , punctures separated by at least a puncture width.

♀: Head width 6.0 mm; body length 17.5 mm; forewing length 14.7 mm. Coloration as in the female of E. barthelli but with stronger purple hues. Pubescence black, with whitish on sides of T4 and T5 and discs of S3 and S5 in some specimens. Mesoscutellum with poorly defined row of dense pubescence on median longitudinal groove. T2 with finer, sparser punctures than on E. barthelli .

caption.paragraph: Figures 118-123. Male terminalia of E. micheneri (paratype. Mexico: Jalisco, Talpa, KUNHM-ENT 1121712). 118 Seventh metasomal sternum in ventral view 119, 120 Eighth metasomal sternum in ventral and lateral views 121-123 Genital capsule in dorsal, ventral, and lateral views.

subSubSection.paragraph: (Fig. 128) Mexico: Durango, Jalisco, Michoacan , Nayarit. This species appears to be restricted to mid elevation oak and pine forests in the western parts of the Transverse Volcanic Belt.

In addition to the paratypes deposited in SEMC (five males and one female from Mascota, Jaslico, and one male from Santa Tereresa, Nayarit), we also examined the following two females deposited in ECOSUR: 1♀, ECO-TAP-E-118160, Mex ., Dgo. [Durango], San Dimas, 1760 m, 24,53210N , 105,81339W , 2/10/2013, 10:00, Col. Liliana Tlapaya; 1♀, ECO-TAP-E-102831, Mex., Mich. [ Michoacan ], Morelia, J. del Monte, 2172 m, 19,63395N , 101,14644W , 4/7/2013, 10:05, Col. Oscar Martinez Lopez .
Females have been collected on flowers of Salvia sp. ( Lamiaceae ).

Some of the specimens listed under this species by Ayala and Engel (2008) in the section "additional material examined" correspond to E. barthelli . These two species partially overlap in distribution.

caption.paragraph: Figures 124-127. Female paratype of E. Micheneri (Mexico: Jalisco, Mascota, KUNHM-ENT 1121708). 124 Facial view 125 Lateral habitus 126 Dorsal habitus 127 Dorsal view of mesoscutellum.
